unnormalised: **Mental Health Apps: Are they actually helpful, yaar?**
normalised: **Mental Health Apps: Are they actually helpful, friend?**

unnormalised: Okay guys, so I've been seeing a lot of ads lately for mental health apps, like Headspace and Calm. My cousin, Priya in Mumbai, swears by one, saying it helped her manage her anxiety during lockdown. But honestly, I'm a bit skeptical.
normalised: Okay guys, so I've been seeing a lot of ads lately for mental health apps, like Headspace and Calm. My cousin, Priya in Mumbai, swears by one, saying it helped her manage her anxiety during lockdown. But honestly, I'm a bit skeptical.

unnormalised: Has anyone actually used these things consistently? Did they make a real difference, or is it just another way for companies to make Rs. off our insecurities? I mean, can an app *really* replace a good therapist, you know, someone like Dr. Sharma from AIIMS?
normalised: Has anyone actually used these things consistently? Did they make a real difference, or is it just another way for companies to make rupees off our insecurities? I mean, can an app *really* replace a good therapist, you know, someone like Doctor Sharma from A I I M S?

unnormalised: I'm dealing with some post-Diwali blues myself (all that family drama!), and I’m considering giving one a shot. But I’d love to hear some genuine experiences before committing. Are the meditation features any good? Do the sleep stories actually work? Are there any free options worth exploring, or are they all just designed to upsell you a subscription that costs more than rent for a 500 sq ft apartment in Gurgaon?
normalised: I'm dealing with some post-Diwali blues myself (all that family drama!), and I’m considering giving one a shot. But I’d love to hear some genuine experiences before committing. Are the meditation features any good? Do the sleep stories actually work? Are there any free options worth exploring, or are they all just designed to upsell you a subscription that costs more than rent for a five hundred square foot apartment in Gurgaon?

unnormalised: Any recommendations for apps focusing on managing stress and anxiety, particularly with an Indian context? Maybe something that incorporates yoga or Ayurvedic principles? All insights welcome! Thanks!
normalised: Any recommendations for apps focusing on managing stress and anxiety, particularly with an Indian context? Maybe something that incorporates yoga or Ayurvedic principles? All insights welcome! Thanks!
